xxl.core.relational.metaData
Class UnifiedResultSetMetaData

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.metaData.MergedResultSetMetaData
      xxl.core.relational.metaData.UnifiedResultSetMetaData
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResultSetMetaData
public class UnifiedResultSetMetaData
extends MergedResultSetMetaData

Appends a number of given ResultSetMetaData objects to each other and returns a new unified ResultSetMetaData object such that all column names are unique. That is when appending two ResultSetMetaData objects having columns with equal names the resulting UnifiedResultSetMetaData object will unify these columns and merge them to one column.

Field Detail

columns

protected List<List<int[]>> columns
An array representing the columns of this object. Every entry consists of a list, holding the occurrences of the affected column in the wrapped ResultSetMetaData objects.

Constructor Detail

UnifiedResultSetMetaData

public UnifiedResultSetMetaData(ResultSetMetaData... metaData)
Constructs an UnifiedResultSetMetaData object that wraps the given ResultSetMetaData objects. The constructor already performs the calculation of the UnifiedResultSetMetaData object's columns by determining he multiple occurrance of column names.

Parameters:
metaData - an array holding the ResultSetMetaData objects to be appended to one ResultSetMetaData object.

UnifiedResultSetMetaData

public UnifiedResultSetMetaData(Iterator<ResultSetMetaData> metaData)
Constructs an UnifiedResultSetMetaData object that wraps the ResultSetMetaData objects contained by the given iteration.

Parameters:
metaData - an iteration holding the ResultSetMetaData objects to be appended to one ResultSetMetaData object.
Method Detail

getColumnCount

public int getColumnCount()
                   throws SQLException
Returns the number of columns. The number of columns of an UnifiedResultSetMetaData object is equal to the number of the unique column names of the appended ResultSetMetaData objects.

Specified by:
getColumnCount in interface ResultSetMetaData
Specified by:
getColumnCount in class MergedResultSetMetaData
Returns:
the number of columns.
Throws:
SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

originalMetaDataIndices

public Cursor<Integer> originalMetaDataIndices(int column)
                                        throws SQLException
Returns an iteration over the indices of the underlying ResultSetMetaData objects the given column is originated in.

Specified by:
originalMetaDataIndices in class MergedResultSetMetaData
Parameters:
column - number of the column: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ...

originalColumnIndex

public int originalColumnIndex(int originalMetaData,
                               int column)
                        throws SQLException
Determines the original column index from the underlying ResultSetMetaData object with the given index, on which the specified column of this object is based.

Specified by:
originalColumnIndex in class MergedResultSetMetaData
Parameters:
originalMetaData - the index of the underlying ResultSetMetaData object that should be tested for being the origin of the specified column.
column - number of the column: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ... If the given column does not originate in the specified ResultSetMetaData object, the return value has to be 0.
Returns:
the original column number from the underlying ResultSetMetaData object with the given index, on which the specified column of this object is based.
Throws:
SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

originalColumnIndices

public Cursor<int[]> originalColumnIndices(int column)
                                    throws SQLException
Determines the original ResultSetMetaData objects and column indices, on which the specified column of this object is based.

Overrides:
originalColumnIndices in class MergedResultSetMetaData
Parameters:
column - number of the column: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ... If the given column does not originate in the specified ResultSetMetaData object, the return value has to be 0.
Returns:
the original ResultSetMetaData objects and column indices, on which the specified column of this object is based. The returned iteration contains two-dimensional int-arrays holding the index of the original ResultSetMetaData object and the index of the original column.
Throws:
SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
